intro: Brachyactis wangtuensis, commonly known as the Wangtou endemic plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant has a short stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique microclimate of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
